intro: Espeletia vergarae, commonly known as the Vergara's espeletia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous roots. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, exhibiting features such as thick, waxy leaves to reduce water loss. Its structure includes a short, sturdy stem and dense clusters of small, showy flowers. Espeletia vergarae plays a role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stability in its rocky habitat.
